sen.j: 顕子女王（あきこじょおう、寛永17年2月13日 (旧暦)（1640年4月4日） - 延宝4年8月5日 (旧暦)（1676年9月12日））は、江戸幕府第4代将軍・徳川家綱の正室（御台所）。
sen.e: Princess Akiko (April 4, 1640 - September 12, 1676) is Midaidokoro (the legal wife) of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, the fourth Shogun of the Edo Shogunate.
The Princess Akiko (April 4, 1640 - September 12, 1676) was Midaidokoro (the legal wife) of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, the fourth Shogun of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: The を補いました。 is→was,「江戸幕府」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: The Princess Akiko (April 4, 1640 - September 12, 1676) was Midaidokoro (the legal wife) of Ietsuna TOKUGAWA, the fourth Shogun of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 伏見宮貞清親王の第3王女。
sen.e: She is the third daughter of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo.
She was the third princess of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo.
sen.cmt: is→was,daughter→princess と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She was the third princess of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo.

sen.j: 幼称は浅宮（あさのみや）、院号は高巌院（こうげんいん）。
sen.e: Her name was Asanomiya when she was a child, and her Ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman comparable standing) is Kogenin.
Her name was Asanomiya when she was a child, and her Ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman comparable standing) is Kogenin.
sen.cmt: Emperor→emperor, is→was と修正しました。
sen.e: Her name was Asanomiya when she was a child, and her Ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman comparable standing) is Kogenin.

sen.j: 第8代将軍・徳川吉宗正室の理子女王は姪に当たる。
sen.e: Princess Masako, who is the legal wife of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, the eighth Shogun of the Edo Shogunate, is her niece.
The Princess Masako, who was the legal wife of the eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, was her niece.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。is→was,Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, the eighth Shogun of the Edo Shogunate→the eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA と修正しました。
sen.e: The Princess Masako, who was the legal wife of the eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, was her niece.

sen.j: 明暦3年（1657年）に家綱と婚姻し、江戸城西の丸へ入る。
sen.e: In 1657, she got married to Ietsuna and started living in Nishinomaru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of the Edo-jo Castle.
In 1657, she married Ietsuna and entered Nishinomaru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of the Edo-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: got married to→married,started living in→entered と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1657, she married Ietsuna and entered Nishinomaru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of the Edo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 万治2年（1659年）9月5日、本丸へ移り、御台様と称される。
sen.e: On October 20, 1659, she moved to Honmaru (a main compound of a castle) and was called Midaisama (the legal wife of Shogun; the same meaning as Midaidokoro).
On October 20, 1659, she moved to Honmaru (a main compound of a castle) and was called Midaisama (the legal wife of Shogun; the same meaning as Midaidokoro).
On October 20, 1659, she moved to Honmaru (a main compound of a castle) and was called Midaisama (the legal wife of Shogun; the same meaning as Midaidokoro).

sen.j: 延宝元年（1673年）、従三位に叙任。
sen.e: In 1673, she was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
In 1673, she was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
In 1673, she was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 延宝4年（1676年）8月5日、37歳で死去。
sen.e: On September 12, 1676, she died at the age of 37.
On September 12, 1676, she died at the age of 37.
On September 12, 1676, she died at the age of 37.

sen.j: 東叡山寛永寺に葬られる。
sen.e: She was buried in Kanei-ji Temple on Mt. Toei.
She was buried in Kanei-ji Temple on Mt. Toei.
She was buried in Kanei-ji Temple on Mt. Toei.

sen.j: 戒名は高巌院贈正二位潤円真大姉。
sen.e: Her Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is "Kogenin Zou Shonii Junen Shindaishi."
Her Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Kogenin Zo Shonii Junen Shindaishi.
sen.cmt: Zou→Zo と修正しました。クォーツを削除しました。
sen.e: Her Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Kogenin Zo Shonii Junen Shindaishi.

sen.j: なお、家綱との間に子供は無かった。
sen.e: In addition, she did not have any children with Ietsuna.
In addition, she did not have any children with Ietsuna.
In addition, she did not have any children with Ietsuna.

sen.j: 延宝5年（1677年）8月2日、従一位が追贈された。
sen.e: On August 29, 1677, she was posthumously conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
On August 29, 1677, she was posthumously conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
On August 29, 1677, she was posthumously conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
